md:
giải nghĩa từ "pointed" sang tiếng việt; đưa ra nghĩa tiếng việt theo từ loại và đưa ra câu ví dụ, các từ liên quan và các từ trái nghĩa.

* Pointed (adjective)
	+ Meaning: Having a sharp point or tip.
	+ Vietnamese: Nhọn, sắc.
	+ Example sentence: The pointed roof of the house was a distinctive feature of the architecture.
	+ Related words: sharp, acute, tapered.
	+ Antonyms: blunt, rounded.

* Pointed (verb)
	+ Meaning: To direct or aim something, such as a finger or a weapon, at someone or something.
	+ Vietnamese: Chỉ, hướng.
	+ Example sentence: She pointed the camera at the sunset and took a beautiful photo.
	+ Related words: aim, direct, target.
	+ Antonyms: ignore, disregard.

* Pointed (verb)
	+ Meaning: To make a comment or remark that is intended to criticize or draw attention to something.
	+ Vietnamese: Nhắc, chỉ trích.
	+ Example sentence: He pointed out the mistake in the report and suggested corrections.
	+ Related words: comment, remark, criticize.
	+ Antonyms: praise, commend.
html:
giải nghĩa từ "pointed" sang tiếng việt; đưa ra nghĩa tiếng việt theo từ loại và đưa ra câu ví dụ, các từ liên quan và các từ trái nghĩa.

  • Pointed (adjective)

    • Meaning: Having a sharp point or tip.
    • Vietnamese: Nhọn, sắc.
    • Example sentence: The pointed roof of the house was a distinctive feature of the architecture.
    • Related words: sharp, acute, tapered.
    • Antonyms: blunt, rounded.

  • Pointed (verb)

    • Meaning: To direct or aim something, such as a finger or a weapon, at someone or something.
    • Vietnamese: Chỉ, hướng.
    • Example sentence: She pointed the camera at the sunset and took a beautiful photo.
    • Related words: aim, direct, target.
    • Antonyms: ignore, disregard.

  • Pointed (verb)

    • Meaning: To make a comment or remark that is intended to criticize or draw attention to something.
    • Vietnamese: Nhắc, chỉ trích.
    • Example sentence: He pointed out the mistake in the report and suggested corrections.
    • Related words: comment, remark, criticize.
    • Antonyms: praise, commend.
